Package com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.map

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    MapDisplayEvents
    An interface of all possible event callback methods provided by Map Displays and Map Display Controls.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    MapCanvas
    A base implementation canvas for performing drawing operations on.
    MapClip
    Keeps track of the dirty areas of a canvas
    MapColorPalette
    Additional functionality on top of Bukkit's MapPalette
    MapDisplay
    A MapDisplay updates and displays map contents to a group of players set as owners.
    MapDisplay.Layer
    A single layer in the Z-buffer of the virtual map
    MapDisplayProperties
    Helper class to make getting and setting Map Item properties easier
    MapDisplayTile
    A single 128x128 map display tile.
    MapFont<K>
    A generic Map Font type that binds sprite characters to value keys.
    MapPlayerInput
    Input controller for virtual map navigation and UI.
    MapResourcePack
    Resource Management class that loads models and textures from the Vanilla Minecraft jar or zip resource pack archives.

    Before using, call VANILLA.load() when enabling your plugin to download and install this Minecraft client jar.
    MapSession
    Maintains information about the player owners that own the session of a Map Display.
    MapSession.Owner  
    MapTexture  
    MCSDFlat
    Map color space data that is read from and written to in a flat GZIP compressed format.
    MCSDGenCiede2000
    This class is used to generate the RGB<>Color transformation mapping.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    MapBlendMode
    A blend mode used when drawing on a canvas
    MapEventPropagation
    A mode of propagating an event through a map widget hierarchy
    MapFont.Alignment
    The alignment of the characters when drawn on a canvas
    MapPlayerInput.Key
    The key belonging to a key change event for a player
    MapResourcePack.ResourceType
    A type of resource that can be read from a Resource Pack
    MapSessionMode
    What conditions must be met to exit a Map Display Session
